articles.author: Tim De Chant
articles.title: Mycocycle uses mushrooms to upcycle old tires and construction waste | TechCrunch
articles.description: The startup's fungi use their mycelium to consume oil-based rubbers and plastics, creating new bio-based materials in the process.
articles.content:
Usually, when something starts to rot, it gets pitched in the trash. But Joanne Rodriguez wants to turn the concept of rot on its head by growing fungus on trash to turn it into something better.

articles.title: Adding wild fungi to soil could make trees store more carbon
articles.description: A loblolly pine plantation in the state of Georgia is the test site for a start-up company trying to see if improving the fungi and other microbes in soil can help trees grow bigger and faster
articles.content:
